title: Openscapes Team Compass
text:
Clone openscapes/team-compass repo (I cloned using RStudio’s Git pane)
Install quarto library
install.packages("quarto")

title: Openscapes Team Compass
text:
Build the book, from the R Console:
quarto::quarto_serve()

title: Openscapes Team Compass
text:
Run this before pushing to GitHub to publish:
quarto::quarto_render()

title: Welcome
section: How to use the team compass
text:
Openscapes team members should help document everything relevant to operating the organization in the Openscapes team compass, and give it precedence over all other kinds of documentation unless explicitly stated otherwise in the team compass.
If you see information here that is out of date, please propose an edit in the team compass repository.
See below for a brief overview of each section of the Team Compass, or browse the sections to the left on your own.

title: Welcome
text:
Information about working with the Openscapes team, understanding our processes and projects, and generally getting oriented.
upcoming

title: Welcome
text:
The Champions Program provides open data science mentorship to cohorts of research teams and is the flagship program of Openscapes. This section contains information about the Champions program, as well as ongoing updates about where information is stored.
update
:caption: Champions Program
:maxdepth: 1
champions/about
champions/operations
champions/community

title: Welcome
text:
Contains information about the Openscapes team and our projects, and some useful resources to learn more.

title: Welcome
text:
Information about the broader Openscapes organization, as well as its mission and structure.

title: Welcome
text: Openscapes is part of the open science movement and supported and inspired by the many diverse communities and efforts working for more inclusive and kinder research culture. This Team Compass document is modeled after https://2i2c.org/team-compass/.
